name: Hotel Le d'Avaugour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We normally travel to France outwith high season and therefor can pick and choose our accommodation. On this occasion, work committments meant we had to book high season at short notice and therefor choice was more limited.
reviews.title: Charming, would definitely stay again

reviews.text: I would certainly choose this hotel again for another trip, the location was ideal for wandering around the lovely centre of Dinan and choosing a restaurant for our meal. Our room was overlooking the gardens and ramparts and was nicely decorated with a good sized bathroom. We had spent the previous night in Bournemouth before catching the ferry from Poole to Cherbourg and this hotel was much better value for money compared with the limited choice we had there.
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings About This Hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast offered a good buffet compared with many of the french hotels which offer "only" juice, coffee and croissants (although often excellent quality)
reviews.title: Hotel with fantastic views & location
Not as charming as it appears
reviews.text: The staff were particularly pleasant and helpful.

reviews.title: Be ready to rise and shine at 0500
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights in Dinan, which is a wonderful and charming town. Hotel d'Avaugour disappointed, as our rooms looked nothing like the pictures on its website. Instead of charming floral prints, our rooms were obviously decorated back in the 70's. However, the bathrooms were nice, as was the breakfast. I was really shocked to find out that the heater in our room didn't work and asked to be moved to another room. We were then told that none of the radiator heaters in the rooms worked. Now, I understand that if one is not staying in a luxury hotel, air conditioning cannot be expected in Europe; however, I can't say I've ever heard of a hotel room without heat! To be fair, the staff did give us a portable heater for one room, and the staff is really what made our stay so pleasant. Both the girls working at reception were really wonderful.

reviews.title: Warm, friendly atmosphere
reviews.text: Lovely spot: convenient, charming, beautiful remodeled public areas, bar, drop-dead-gorgeous gardens, and wonderful, charming, sweet staff. Public parking is across the street and you have to remember to run out in the morning and feed the meter. Walking is very convenient into the lovely walled city. Bathroom was large and well--equipped. The room's decor was traditional and not new. I'd suggest that the old desks removed from the hall so it is not so cluttered and that the lights allow the area to remain lit for more than 5 seconds. Otherwise, I loved our stay there.

reviews.title: Lovely hotel with excellent staff
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights here, the rooms overlooked the main square and were well furnished with excellent bathrooms. The ground floor reception, bar, lounge & breakfast room were completed renovated in the winter of 09-10 and are lovely. The staff were welcoming, polite and very helpful, even stopping the traffic for us to drive away when we left. The garden, overlooking the ramparts, is a lovely place to sit and have a drink. We hope to return to Dinan and this hotel.

reviews.title: Situated perfectly but a plain room
reviews.text: Just returned from 2 nights at the Hotel. First I will say that it is perfectly located in town with good parking across the street. The women at the front desk were most helpful (I needed a doctor's visit) and polite with perfect English (much needed in this case) The garden out back where we had breakfast every morning was very nice and made for lovely photos. However, I defy anyone to come up with rooms that are as charming as the lovely room on their website with the red checked bedspread, flowers and tea. I looked in no less than 10 rooms on 2 floors while the maids were cleaning. They are all plain ordinary rooms, which would be just fine if I hadn't been lead to believe the rooms would have a modicum of charm. So go on the website and find the plainest looking room and know that that will be what your will look like and you won't be disappointed. Also, be sure to book a garden view room and not a street view.

reviews.title: A triumph of charm and service in the traditional style
reviews.text: Have you ever read a Hemingway novel and noticed that the type of hotel mentioned within the pages seems so vastly different from what one experiences now? Do you ever notice that you feel depressed when you stay at a 4-Star Intercontinental Business hotel, with slick young "Hotel Management" graduates at the helm? If the answer is "yes", then you have to come to Dinan and stay in this Hotel. The owner, Nicholas is extremely friendly and accommodating, obviously knowledgeable about the area, and very invested in his guests experiencing the best of what Brittany has to offer. The hotel is charming, and everything is done well (even the coffee is fantastic).

reviews.title: Lovely hotel, fabulous staff in charming town
reviews.text: Dinan itself is a medieval town, completely spared by the bombs of WWII, and probably the most beautiful place I have ever visited. The restaurants are all top-notch, on par if not better than your average upscale Manhattan Bistro. There are breathtaking bicycle trips available from the front door of the hotel (Nicholas has free bicycles to lend), and the town has beautiful preserved ramparts and street walks. The back garden of the hotel is actually mounted on one of the old ramparts, a vast space, 50 feet high, perched on a tower with 270 degree views of the valley and river below.

reviews.title: Perfect position
reviews.text: Stayed here with my daughter for the Fete des Remparts. As always the staff were charming and very helpful. The garden is beautiful and a haven from the Fete. We had a great view of the cavalcade from our window but the double glazing meant that she wasn't disturbed as the celebrations carried on into the night. This was our third stay. The rooms have been re-decorated over that time but the warm welcome remains the same. We'll be going back in three weeks time. Quite expensive during the Fete but given its perfect position that's to be expected.

reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel
reviews.text: This is a wonderful hotel with a wonderful location in a wonderful town. The hotel is located right on the main square, actually inside the ramparts of the old town. There are two large parking lots across the street, but you will have to pay during the day (9:00-12:00 and 14:00-18:00); also there is a market there on Thursdays, so you will have to find alternate parking on Wednesday night.

reviews.title: HOTEL LE D'AVAUGOUR: Excellent Hotel and Great Staff!
reviews.text: Our room was large and very nicely furnished, and we had a view of the lovely garden behind the hotel. The breakfast was above average, with a good selection of breads & pastries, fruit, yogurt, cereal, and boiled eggs. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and they gave us good suggestions for restaurants and things to see in the old city.

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at HOTEL LE D'AVAUGOUR in Dinan for two nights in late June.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: The facility is very nice...good room and great bathroom set up.
We stayed here on 12th & 13th August. A taxi was arranged by the hotel to collect us when we arrived.
reviews.title: Highy Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very comfortable hotel, good central location, rooms average size and very clean. Bathrooms look just redone in pretty tiles and solid granite: separate toilet (useful!), shower in good size bath, great hairdryer, lots of towels, loads of hot water.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Dinan

likes.liked: — The large rooms and the hotel garden. Plus it was in a great location.

reviews.text: Lovely breakfast room, lounge & garden. Drinks available just about 24hrs a day. Staff were faultless, very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great location...great town!

reviews.text: Due to bad weather we had to stay an extra night but we were booked back into our rooms that had just been cleaned throughout without any problem.
reviews.title: The website is better than the experience

reviews.text: We spent one night at the Hotel d'Avaugour in Dinan, and hated to leave the next day. We were on a two-week driving trip in France, and this was the nicest hotel we stayed in. We had a large room facing the back garden. It was so peaceful. The bird were chirping, and the garden area was lovely. This place is great.
reviews.title: Terrific Location, Charming Helpful Staff

description: Hotel Logis d’Avaugour is in the heart of Dinan, in a historic stone townhouse set on the town ramparts. It offers charming rooms and suites fitted with all modern comforts.
